name: Luck Leech
description: The Luck Leech is a Medium-sized fey creature with a deceptive and sly appearance, known for its charm and agility as well as its studded leather armor.
memorable: It can absorb luck from nearby creatures, turning their fortunes into advantages for itself.
goals: To exploit the fortune of others and gain power through manipulation.
relations: It may serve or be served by other fey creatures or dark powers, lurking in areas of high fortune.
environment: Typically found in areas rich with magic or luck, potentially near treasure or monuments of fortune.
strengths: Exceptional agility and charm, with high skill proficiencies in stealth and deception.
weaknesses: Reliant on other creatures' successes, making it vulnerable to opponents who are less capable of rolling high.
attacks: Can make multiple biting arm attacks that deal both piercing and necrotic damage, capable of blind and curse effects.
most_powerful_ability: Feast of Fortune can inflict significant psychic damage and can also blind multiple targets while increasing its own luck.
senses: Keen perception with a passive score of 16, indicating it is quite aware of its surroundings.
skills: Excels in deception and stealth, making it a tricky and dangerous foe in social encounters and combat.
additional_information: Immune to necrotic damage and unaffected by frightened condition.
Gains luck points based on the fortunes of nearby creatures.
Can reroll low results without expending luck points.
Has strong saving throws in Dexterity and Wisdom.
Calculates hit points based on a high Constitution modifier.
test_queries: fey that curses with falling fortunes
